titleStmt.title: Ecclesiastes, othervvise called The preacher Containing Salomons sermons or commentaries (as it may probably be collected) vpon the 49. Psalme of Dauid his father. Compendiously abridged, and also paraphrastically dilated in English poesie, according to the analogie of Scripture, and consent of the most approued writer thereof. Composed by H.L. Gentleman. Whereunto are annexed sundrie sonets of Christian passions heretofore printed, and now corrected and augmented, with other affectionate sonets of a feeling conscience of the same authors.
titleStmt.author: Lok, Henry.
Lok, Henry. Sundry Christian passions contained in two hundred sonnets.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Richard Field, dwelling in the Blacke-friers neare Ludgate,

notesStmt.note: "Sundry Christian passions, contained in two hundred sonnets", first published separately in 16696, has separate dated title page and pagination; register is continuous.
Identified as STC 2765 on UMI microfilm reel 1539.
Reproductions of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 336 and at reel 1539 (same copy filmed twice).
